intro: Amphithalea fourcadei, commonly known as the fourcade's amphithalea, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and often showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
